summary: This document consists of four 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 11, 2019. The sheets record staff observations of inmates in continuous lockdown status, requiring checks at least twice per hour. The documents are reviewed by a Lieutenant and Captain.

events.title: Inmate Observation Checks at MCC New York SHU
events.description: Staff at the MCC New York Special Housing Unit conducted mandatory 30-minute observation checks on inmates in continuous locked down status (administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) throughout the day and night.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a prison log detailing inmate observation procedures at MCC New York's Special Housing Unit on July 11, 2019.
Inmates in continuous lockdown status (administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) were to be observed at least twice per hour, on an irregular schedule no more than 40 minutes apart.
The check sheets are divided into three watches: Morning Watch, Day Watch, and Evening Watch, each overseen by an Operations Lieutenant.
Each sheet was reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, indicating a chain of custody and accountability for inmate welfare checks.
